snippet: The state’s highest court “encouraged” Gov. Jay Inslee to call the Legislature into a special session to find a way to close the gap in spending between rich and poor schools.
abstract: Washington Supreme Court issues $100,000 per day fine on state, citing its failure to address uneven funding of schools in rich and poor districts; calls on Gov Jay Inslee to hold special session of Legislature to come up with plan; at root of case is state's over-reliance on local taxes for education funding.
lead_paragraph: The state’s highest court “encouraged” Gov. Jay Inslee to call the Legislature into a special session to find a way to close the gap in spending between rich and poor schools.

headline.main: Washington State Faces $100,000-a-Day Fine Until Schools Plan Is Reached
headline.print_headline: Washington State Faces $100,000-a-Day Fine Until Schools Plan Is Reached
